channel.title: Error Click for Details
channel.description:
My friend is having trouble with his webclient, some people can play it and others cant. Im one of those who cant. The problem is when people try to load the webclient it says "Error, Click for Details" What can he do to fix that problem or what can I do to fix that problem? If you try and load the client, it wont even load it just make a loud sound.
so if you can help me i would really apperciate it! PLEASE Comment on this telling how to fix it or telling my friend how he can fix this problem.

item.title: Error Click for Details
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“runeherorsps, post:6, topic:451440”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=554324.msg4060083#msg4060083 date=1343339601]

it means he jarred it with a higher java version than the one you’re using.

OR just use what I said.
[/quote]
I am not saying to use anything, I am just explaning the error. :P[/quote]
Oh lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Error Click for Details
item.dc:creator: @Gravity_pk Gravity pk
item.description:
@Gravity_pk wrote:

i had the problem when i first made my webclient, k so heres my html code i used with an old one as an example.

GravityScape

k so see where it says, “client.class” which i made in green, that was my error, i tried changing it from “Client.class” to “client.class” to “Gui.class” to “gui.class” then client.class worked for me, it was on my old delta source, but the source doesnt matter that will mess up i was getting the same error, so try playing around with that, the capital makes the difference, lemme know if it helped :). and if for some reason you dont even know what that is thats an html code, just a random one i used (it was garbage :])

Read full topic

item.title: Error Click for Details
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Always does this to me. Just save the page (via File, Save Page) and go to the folder you saved the page. Somewhere in that folder should be (SITESNAME)_files. In it, you should see a .jar file. Run that and it should work.

Read full topic
